title: Rugby World Cup 2019 rankings - part two: Will Greenwood's verdict on which quarter-finalists have the silkiest centre partnerships
text:
Throughout the week, Telegraph Sport's expert columnists will be ranking the quarter-finalists by positions. The second installment sees Will Greenwood cast his expert eye over which teams have the best and worst centre partnerships.

This is in order of importance to the teams' success, how the players in these positions can influence games during the knockout stages of the tournament.

8. Japan (Ryoto Nakamura and Timothy Lafaele)

I wrote about these two in my column last weekend. They haven’t grabbed the headlines but they are a quality pairing. They make you tackle them. Perhaps not as direct as, say, Jamie Roberts or Bundee Aki. Lafaele especially likes to test you with footwork and find...
description: Throughout the week, Telegraph Sport's expert columnists will be ranking the quarter-finalists by positions.
